It never has. And I’m a little pissed off about that.
Bless me, Father, for I have sinned...
Drunk driving, resisting arrest, and I think disorderly conduct.
This thing’s about 30 minutes old, Josh. I don’t know exactly what happened.
How much does the press know?
I swear to God, I don’t think the cops know.
They don’t know that they’ve arrested Roberto Mendoza?
They don’t know it’s that Roberto Mendoza.
I got a cab.  I’ll let you know what’s going on.
Stay ahead of the pace, Sam, and have Toby page me. We don’t even know if this guy’s  called a lawyer. Is he sitting in a jail cell right now?
Thank you. Thank you very much.
Thanks David. Good to see you.
It’s not as bad as you think, C.J.
Was the President’s nominee for the Supreme Court just arrested for drunk driving?
Then it’s pretty bad, isn’t it?
C.J., we’ve vetted the man. I’m not saying he’s not a heavy drinker, I’m saying he  doesn’t drink.
Then what was he pulled over for?
I stepped off the edge of the world.
‘Cause he’s a crazy man who’s out to ruin my life.
That’s what he’s out to do. Has anyone posted bail?
It’s not Cook County, Toby. It’s Friday night in Wesley, Connecticut.
Believe me when I tell you this, C.J. I will figure out a way to blame this on you.
I have no doubt about that.

Have someone find his lawyer and talk to him. Sam, there’s an Air Force Lear jet with  its motor running. Fly to Westchester County airport, rent a car, drive to Wesley, and  get the next associate Justice of the Supreme Court out of jail. C.J., Sam sees one  reporter when he gets off that plane, I’m gonna blame you.
The judge and I are gonna have an abrupt conversation.
I want my phone to ring once every 15 minutes. I want to know what’s going on!
Well, the first thing I’ll tell you is, there’s no such thing.

I-I’ll give you an example from this week. In fact, the story I’m about to tell you  all happened within the last 36 hours. Anyone who’s been reading the papers in the  last few days has probably been following along with what we call the news cycle  that wouldn’t end. Depending on how you look at it, it started either with a cabinet  secretary losing her temper, a committee chairman baiting her during a hearing, the  President answering a question he shouldn’t have, a dentist appointment, or me being  stupid.  One thing’s for sure, it  started out as a day that was supposed to trumpet the President’s vision for  educational reform.
I have complete confidence in you.
I feel bathed in your confidence as well, Toby.
Forgive student loans to people who become teachers --

-- and spend at least three years teaching in a rural or inner-city school. Give cash  bonuses to people who leave other careers to become teachers and provide federal money  for grants to individual school districts to use older, more experienced teachers to  train younger, less experienced teachers.
Should note that half of all new teachers quit in the first three years.
It’s right here on my index card, Toby.
We should push it to one o’clock.
Do it after the bill signing. Let this be the story. Let’s control the news cycle.
Carol, let’s move the briefing to one.
Yes, and this is a perfect excuse to postpone the thing.
I have a dentist appointment at noon.
About a month now, but it’ll go away by itself.
Carol, set the briefing for two o’clock. Keep the appointment.
Your teeth are the best friends you got, C.J.
You take care of them, they’ll take care of you.
When’d you start talking like this?
Well, yes, she used that word.
I want anything that might be on the wire already about the HUD Secretary calling Jack  Wooden a racist.
No, Bonnie, I want it at whatever leisurely pace you two feel...
I want it now.  On C-SPAN, she called him a racist?
Nah, not just Wooden. She was pretty careful to include all Republicans.
Why are you good humored about this?
She was baited and she was right.
Well, wasn’t that clever of her?

Donald Morales, who is the spokesman for the Department of Housing and Urban Development,  and who was wishing he hadn’t gotten out of bed that morning, confirms what happened.  Now there’s the matter of telling the President.
Gets a little bit worse, actually.
“When reporters confronted Secretary O’Leary in a hallway outside the hearing  room, she defended...” Oh come on!
I’ll take care of it.  She on her way here?
She’ll be here in half an hour.
Yeah.  “If the shoe fits.” Is that the best she could do?
Of her many transgressions, Mr. President, let’s not worry about she resorted to cliché.

The President spoke briefly.  But, he spoke. He signed the bill. He gave away the pens. Then he took  a few questions from the press. Now, before I go on, it should be pointed out that  according to every poll conducted in the universe, the issue that concerns Americans  more than any other is education. Now, The President has just signed off on $700,000,000  in new money for education and announced a plan of aggressive education initiative.  What do you suppose the first question from the press was?

Let me say that I have great confidence in Deborah O’Leary. She’s done a terrific job  at HUD, helping thousands of people make the very difficult transition from joblessness  and homelessness to more fulfilling and productive lives.
I was hoping you weren’t going to notice that, Danny.

Then I will tell you that I agree the Republican Party does not have a comprehensive  program for combating poverty in this country. That being said, there are countless  Republicans who are working very hard to change their party’s legacy on some of these  issues. And I hope to be working with them to do just that.

If only we’d stopped it right there. If only we’d said, uh, “Sorry, The President  can’t take any questions right now,” or, uh, “We’ll cover this in a briefing,” or,  “The building is on fire!”  But for some reason, it took us all a  moment to realize that there was no Press Secretary in the room.
Frankly, I think she went too far in assigning motive to Congressman Wooden and the  Republican Party.
She’ll be meeting with Leo McGarry.
Folks, all this is gonna be covered in the two  o’clock briefing. The President’s late for lunch with the U.N. ambassador. I’m sorry.
The U.N. ambassador is in Portugal.
Eight words. “The President’s not taking any questions right now.” If we’d just stepped  in 30 seconds sooner.
You’re from Connecticut. What exit do we want for Wesley?
Toby, I’m kind of in the middle of something here.
Call me when you know something.   Sorry about that.
The, uh, trade deficit. Where was I?

The day would’ve gone a lot differently. The President had said that Secretary O’Leary  should apologize. The press wanted to know if she would be fired if she didn’t and we  didn’t have an answer. She was coming up to the White House for a showdown. This was  what the day was about now. And the day was about to get worse...because I was about  to step to the plate.
We’re supposed to be going east.
How do you know we’re going east?
The sun rises in the east.
Also, that bright star in the northern sky is Polaris.
Hey, Galileo, get off at the next exit and turn the car around.

Secretary O’Leary was told that Leo McGarry wanted to see her as soon as possible.  There was no question that she was going to be angry about the President publicly  asking her to apologize, but at the moment, that was Leo’s problem.
We blew the press today, we’ll come to that. But Debbie, I’ve got videotape of your side  of the story.
His narrow-minded constituents are also our narrow-minded constituents.
When angels dance on pinheads, Debbie. We need their votes on any number of issues,  including, by the way, the budget for the department of Housing and Urban Development.
Thanks. Having been born yesterday on a turnip truck...
I think, Debbie, your role first and foremost is to serve the President--a task today at  which you failed spectacularly.
Well, now you’re gonna apologize for it.
You’re doing great work, Deb. The President’s nuts about you, always has been. He’ll cry  for three minutes after he fires your ass and then he’ll say “What’s next?”
It’s the cost of doing business.
Deb, he’s been trying to provoke you for months. When you give in to him, you surrender  the high ground.
You forgot what your grandfather taught you.
“Never argue with a drunk or a fool.”
Mostly he’s upset that you couldn’t come up with anything better than “if the shoe fits.”   Good luck.

So that should’ve been it, right? C.J. Cregg does the two o’clock briefing, tells them  Secretary O’Leary has an apology for Congressman Wooden. All questions on the matter will  be handled by her spokesperson, Donald Morales, and redirects their attention to the 700  million bucks of yours that we just spent on teachers.   Who here has had emergency root canal?
Why are you talking like that?
Yeah, I heard you the first time, I was just amusing myself.
I can suggest some othew things you can do wiff yourseff.
You’re gonna need to stop saying that, ‘cause you just look and sound so ridiculous.
I have to cancew the bwiefing.
You can’t cancel the briefing, C.J. You got to wrap up O’Leary, you got to move them back  to the bill signing.
Sorry, did... did you just say my name?
You weally think I can do it?
Don’t be insane, C.J. You’re not going to a press briefing looking like Bullwinkle.
Oh, so once again you’we just hawing a wittle fun!
When can you take the cotton out?
Two houws. I’w have Cawow cancew the bwiefing.
I don’t get hostile! I don’t get randomly hostile, I get hostile when hostility’s  called for.
What’s he doing in Fwoggy Bowtew?
I just wanted to see if I could make you say “Foggy Bottom.” Sam’s working with  the speechwriters.
Toby’s with Leo and the President.
Hey there cats and kittens. This is Josh Lyman  coming at you with your two o’clock briefing!
Josh, pwease be vewy cawefuw. Twy vewy, vewy hawd not to destwoy us.
You shouldn’t say that C.J., you’ve got a great body... Here we go. Woo!
I talk to reporters all the time.

Let me tell you something, mi compadre. You guys have been coddled. I’m not your  girlfriend, I’m not your camp counselor, and I’m not you sixth grade teacher you  had a crush on. I’m a graduate of Harvard and Yale and I believe that my powers of  debate can rise to meet the Socratic wonder that is the White House Press Corps.

I’d like to say a couple things in my own defense. First of all, everything was fine.  I dispensed of the Deborah O’Leary matter with ease and poise. I opened the room up to  questions while imposing a discipline I felt had been lacking in C.J.’s briefings.
I’m gonna take one question a piece.
Mike, you sure you want your one question to be that stupid?
The President quit smoking years ago.
Let me emphasize the President is pleased that unemployment has dropped another point five  percent as a result...
The President will do everything in his power to maintain the robust economy that has  created millions of new jobs, improved productivity and kept a lid on inflation.
Twenty-four PhD’s and a Counsel of Economy Advisors, Katie. They have a plan to fight  inflation.
Yeah, Danny. We have a secret inflation plan.
I guess that’s pretty much when the wheels came off the wagon.
Sam feels we’re zeroing in on it.
We’ve been navigating by the North Star, which turned out to be the Delta shuttle from  LaGuardia. It’s a miracle we’re not in Nantucket right now.
Toby, how hard can it be to find the Wesley police station?
I don’t know, Josh, but while we’re looking, can you tell me a little more about the  President’s secret plan to fight inflation?
How long until you let up on me on that?
Oh, it’s gonna take a little while I would think.
Call me when you know something.
There’s a store open up there. I’m gonna pull over and ask ‘em if they know where the  Wesley police station is.
Or you could just pull in there,  at the Wesley police station and ask them.
Let’s get this done and get outta here.
My name is Sam Seaborn. I work for the President of the United States.  Is your watch commander around?

Officer Peter, we’re in a certain amount of trouble tonight  and the only thing I’ve got going for me is that you’re in more trouble than we are.  My name is Sam Seaborn, I work for the President and the sooner you reach the conclusion  that I’m telling you the truth the better off we’re all gonna be. Why don’t you go get  your watch commander?
Let me tell you something. If we’d stayed on the Merritt parkway instead of getting  of at exit 29 and going east to Greenwich, I don’t think we’d wound up in Bridgeport  so many times.
Sergeant, I’m Sam Seaborn. I’m the Deputy White House Communications Director. That’s my  boss, Toby Ziegler.
I know how you feel. You have Roberto Mendoza locked up back there.
My business is to tell you to unlock the cell and give me Mendoza.
Sergeant, you’ve arrested a federal judge who’s the President’s nominee for the U.S.  Supreme Court.
Danny Concannon had thrown me a knuckle ball in the dirt, which I’d taken a big swing at  and - just like that - the President had a secret plan to fight inflation.
I was talking to Danny. I was kidding!
I honestly can’t remember the question.
This’d be a great time to feel a little support from you, Donna!
Okay, good, that’s a start. Tell me what you think I should do right now.
Yeah, that’s the face I wanted to see right now.
What the heww happened in thewe?
You wewe vague, you wewe howstiwe, you wewe bewwigewant!
You know what it’s gonna take fow me to fix this?
No, you’we not. You awe not evew awwowed in my pwess woom again!
Donna, call up Toby’s office and see if he was watching.
Never mind.  Support me on this.
Have you fallen on your head?
Have you fallen down and hit your head on something hard?
I feel really bad about this.
Oh, well then I guess that’s all that really matters.
That was some very good television, Josh, and I think four network news directors will  bear me out on that tonight.
I really think this isn’t as bad as you’re making it out to be.
A secwet pwan to fight infwation!
Okay, C.J., for a little while you’re gonna have to write it down.
Although I’ve gotta say, telling a reporter his question’s stupid’s not like a page out  of Dale Carnegie or anything.
Believe me, Sam, the only thing that could make my day worse is if Roberto Mendoza got  involved.

Roberto Mendoza is the President’s nominee to fill Crouch’s seat on the Supreme Court.  The President put Toby Ziegler in charge of his confirmation, which is a huge  responsibility. A failed confirmation for the Court is a body blow to a presidency.  Besides which, he’s a brilliant jurist and we badly want him on the bench. The  confirmation process is a tough needle to thread. You gotta make a lot of friends and  Supreme Court nominees don’t speak before their confirmation, they let the White House  speak for them. Something Toby’s had a little bit of trouble teaching Roberto Mendoza.
He said the President was wrong?
He said the Pwesident was wong to make Secwetawy O’Weawy apowogize-
He said the President was wrong to make Secretary O’Leary apologize.
I’m saying, to whom did he say it to?
I thought he’s on vacation in Nova Scotia?
What, they called him in Nova Scotia?
How the hell did they find him in Nova Scotia?
They have telephones in Nova Scotia, Leo. It’s not Amish country.
I really think of all the people in this building, Josh, you want to  be the last person to speak right now.
The Pwesident needs to be bwiefed on the events of the day.
C.J., so help me if you use the words “Pwesident” or “bwiefed” again.

All right. The President lands in New Orleans in an hour and a half. There’ll be no  press at the Labor Conference. And when he’s done he’s getting right back on the plane  and coming home. Wheels down is 3:00 a.m. He’ll be back in the residence by 3:30.
A lot of this is our fault. And the President probably isn’t going to take this very well  and we just want you to know that we will be there with you in spirit tomorrow morning.
You’re gonna be there with me in every way imaginable, Josh.

If you read the papers, you know that this not the first time this had happened. In  the eight weeks since the President named his nominee, Judge Mendoza has, on various  occasions, publicly criticized the American Bar Association, the AFL-CIO, and the New  York state legislature. Three organizations without which this President would not  have been elected. Putting out the Deborah O’Leary fire from earlier in the day had  been the only thing we’d been successful at, and now Judge Mendoza had...
Hello Mr. Justice. How are you?
No. Judge and I are gonna have a chat.

The hardest job in the White House is President. The second hardest job is not Chief  of Staff, it’s not National Security Advisor, and it’s not Press Secretary, although  I’m gaining a certain amount of respect for Press Secretaries. The second hardest job  in the White House belongs to a 21 year old kid named Charlie Young. He’s what’s called  the President’s body man, his personal aide. He’s with the President morning to night.  He has a range of responsibilities, all of them difficult. But the one he hates most in  this from time to time it is his job to wake the President up in the morning. And on  this particular morning, the President had gone to sleep only three hours earlier.
What could you possibly want right now?
I mean, what in the name of everything holy could you want right now?
And what could you possibly want?

Mendoza was summoned to the White House from his vacation in Nova Scotia. When you  summon someone to the White House, you generally expect to see them within the hour.  Judge Mendoza told us that he would see us in three days. Why three days? Because he  was driving down to D.C., stopping in Connecticut to do some antiquing. Yet another  thing we’d have to tell the President. Who, by the way, had still not woken up.
Charlie, are you aware you’re committing  a federal crime right now?
How did you know the First Lady wasn’t going to be naked when you came in here?   Come to think of it, where the hell is my wife?
Well, the swelling’s gone down. On the other hand, the painkillers have worn off.
He’s driving from Nova Scotia to Washington?

Oh, my guess is, he’ll take the Trans-Canada Highway to New Brunswick, then maybe catch  the 1 and take the scenic route along the coast of Maine. 95 through New Hampshire to  the Mass Pike, and then cut over to the Merritt Parkway round Milford.
Something really kinda freakish about you, you know that?
I’m tired, I’m cranky, and my wife’s in Argentina. Let’s get this over with.
Mr. President, we experienced a few public relations, what’s the word...?
...incidents in the few hours you were away last night.

Yeah?  Oh. First, I’m happy to tell you that the incident involving Secretary  O’Leary and Congressman Wooden has been dispensed with. Though not really, and I’ll get  to that at the end. Sam asked C.J. to move the briefing to two o’clock so that we could  fold in the teachers. C.J. had emergency root canal surgery at noon and so was unable  to brief.
Yeah. A long story short, you’re gonna be reading a bit today about your secret plan  to fight inflation.
I have a secret plan to fight inflation?
Why am I gonna be reading that I do?
It was suggested in the Press Room that you did.
You told the press I have a secret plan to fight inflation?
No, I did not. Let me be absolutely clear, I did not do that. Except, yes, I did that.
Sir, there was this idiotic round robin. It was sarcastic. There’s no way they didn’t  know that. They were just mad at me for imposing discipline and calling them stupid!
Okay, before we go on. C.J., if blood is gushing from the head wound you just received  from a stampeding herd of bison, you’ll do the press briefing.
A secret plan to fight inflation?
There was no turning them back. I denied it for half an hour. They wouldn’t take no  for an answer.
I was crystal clear. They said, “Do you think if the President has a plan to fight  inflation, it’s right that be keep it a secret?” I said, “Of course not!”
Are you telling me that not only did you invent a secret plan to fight inflation, but  now you don’t support it?
When you put it like that...
Mr. President, much as we’d love nothing more than to stand here and watch you beat  the living crap outta Josh, there’s actually a bigger fish to fry.
He told the Chicago Tribune that you were wrong to admonish Secretary O’Leary and  make her apologize.
You said you were gonna fix it.
Frankly sir, that’s ‘cause your nominee for the Supreme Court’s handling himself in a  manner that’s totally unprofessional.
We will have the first of what I think will a series of discussions about professionalism  another time, Toby. Where is Mendoza?
Yes, but he won’t be here until the day after tomorrow.
Is he coming in from Neptune?

He’s vacationing with his wife and son, and they’d prefer to take a leisurely drive  through eastern Canada and New England while stopping for some antique shopping in  Connecticut. I imagine he’ll take the Trans-Canada Highway, the 95...
Okay. We will wait for Mendoza. In the meantime, C.J., you will untangle the Press Corps.
And we will hope that nothing happens today to make this any worse. Although I certainly  wouldn’t bet the house on it. That is all.
Sir, I wanna tell you that I’m sorry and that this mess will be cleaned up in an adult  and professional manner.
If anyone asks you, you quit smoking years ago, and the cigarette you bummed  on Air Force One was for a friend.
Actually, he’s on his way right now. He’s spending the night in Connecticut to do some  antiquing.
Well, you have a problem there.

Judge Mendoza has chronic persistent hepatitis, which is a non-progressive form of  liver inflammation. If he’d had enough to drink to blow point one on the blood-alcohol,  he’d be dead right now.  This is good coffee.
Why didn’t you take a Breathalyzer?
So you give Barney Fife a hard time to make a point.
One phone call, Judge. “Toby, this has happened. Tell ‘em my name’s Roberto Mendoza  and the President’s named me to the bench!”
Judge, due respect. Get your things and let’s go.
He’s also seen you wearing a robe with a gavel in your hand.
Robbie and Laura, where are they right now?

There’s nothing about this that doesn’t stink. If it were me, I’d wanna extract  vengeance, and I’d say “Let justice be done.” I’d also wanna spend some time in a  dark room alone, so that I didn’t have to face my wife and my son and have them see  my humiliation. Rob, I can’t get this done if this is the story. Can’t get it done.  Nothing about this that doesn’t stink. And nothing about it that wouldn’t be better  if you were a Supreme Court Justice. Let me take you to the motel. Go see your boy.

Your lucky night, officers. There isn’t gonna be a report, there isn’t going to be  an investigation, no one’s getting suspended. And no one’s filing a hundred million  dollar lawsuit against the county that they would almost surely win. But in this room,  you’re gonna apologize to Mr. Mendoza. And then you’re gonna get in your squad car and  you’re gonna follow us and you’re gonna apologize to his son.
I also gotta say, you guys could do a better job of marking the exits on the throughway.
Killing me, Judge. You’re absolutely killing me.
Good.   That’s the last time the phone will ring. I promise.

There’s a part of the story I didn’t tell you. I can’t. Trust me, it doesn’t involve...  I-I-I just can’t right now. Ask me back again after the Senate confirms Mendoza.  You really should hear it, it’s a good story.
I don't like putting him in this position.
I just don't want you to think that I'm getting any pleasure in putting him in this  position.
Well, he knew the vote was going to be tight.
I mean it's ironic that it all comes down to a vote on the ethanol tax credit.
Are you being brusque with me?
I'm just saying you can't blame me. It's what you get from having an even number  of senators.
Yeah, you should blame the constitution.
Ron, am I going to meet her on the plane?
Zoey got a new agent on her detail.
Have you seen these new agents?
They've got the hair, the backpacks, the clothes. Walking around campus strapped to a  44 magnum.
Let me tell you something, when it's your kid, you don't want them blending in. You  want them wearing a sign that says, "I'm carrying a loaded gun, and the safety's off."
Can I say this one last time?
Stay at the hotel for the night.
You're not going to sleep on the plane, you're going to be running around all day,  and then you've got the fundraiser to do at night.
I want to come home after the fundraiser.
That's a full day and night. Round trip, D.C. to L.A. in 24 hours. It's really no  good for you.
Your impersonation of my mother is getting sharper and sharper, you know that?
Have a good flight, Mr. President.
No, Mr. President, I wouldn't say they were.
Well, they're not wild about taking off at 3 0'clock in the morning, sir.
Oh, it's going to be great. We're going to race the sun to the pacific horizon!
I'll be sure to tell them that, sir. I'm sure it'll pick them right up.
Morning, Everyone. Sam, it's going to be 50-50 on the ethanol tax credit.
I can still make a couple of calls.
Make all the calls you want, it's going to be 50-50.
Sir, Josh and I would at least like the opportunity to talk about the Al Kiefer  meeting.
You two are so freaked out about this Al Kiefer meeting.
You two want to see the best part about having my job?   Colonel, this is the president. I'm ready to go.
Have you tried the Lancome high-protection sunstick for face and lips?
Plus the Elizabeth Arden modern skin care daily moisturizer.
The two of you understand that we're going to be in California for one day?
Cameron’s going to introduce a bill tomorrow.
I have a feeling Ted Marcus might care.
You've been in the air all night, you don't know anything, you'll get back to him.
Plus, it's Cameron. So, who cares?
Thank you.  This man has got to be stopped!
I'm sorry we haven't had a chance to meet before now. You've been with  Zoey's detail, what?
So, you were commissioned a second lieutenant?
How long have you trained for this assignment?
What, were you the first one to sign up?
You know Zoey's dating my body man, Charlie Young, right?
You don't have an artist's sketch, or psychological profiles, or anything?

Okay. Zoey's 19 and she wants to be a teenager. She wants a college experience, and  I can't blame her. I loved college. So did my other daughters. I want Zoey to be  comfortable with her protection, I don't want her to try and give you the slip. It's  not your job to tell me she wants to cut English Lit, it's not your job to tell me if  she's dying her hair blue, or going to a strip club, or whatever it is she's doing  with her friends. You know what your job is.
If she's cutting English Lit, I want to know about it.
Ethanol accounts for 20 percent of Iowa's corn crop.
That's what we never said enough.
Sam's been calling senators from the plane for the past hour and a half. The next time  my phone rings, it's going to be him telling me it's over.
Look, I said I was sorry.
I had to stay behind for this.
There will be other trips, Margaret.
They've got 54 electoral votes out there. Something tells me that we're not going to  be strangers.

You guys? Everyone? Sorry, but we're landing in a few minutes, and I just wanted to brief  everyone on the President's schedule. The President will be greeted at the airport by  Congressmen Hark and Jennsen, the Mayor and various City Council Members. It's photos  only, no formal remarks. We will depart the airport at 6:20 and head for the hotel, at  which point I predict that we will no longer be on schedule.
I've spent half the nights in my life in hotel rooms, and I still cannot...
Later. You sure this isn't for your room?
Later. You know, there used to be keys...
You stuck it in, you turned it, you...
Well, that's something I really care about.
Interpreting the classics with Poet Laureate Donnatella Moss.
Yeah. Let's do it. Call her, and then we'll do everyone else.
Hang on.  I'd better call him first.
Good morning. You beat me to the door.
I've been on a plane all night.
Seriously, Studio Chairman -- nice work if you can get it.
What do you want to talk about?
Ted, I checked into my hotel room 15 minutes ago, what did you haul my ass out here for?
It's the House. It's procedure. Do you know how many bills get introduced every day that  never get a hearing, let alone a vote?
I came to you because you told me to, now I've got a cab waiting outside...
You're worried about nothing. I'll see you later. The President's looking forward to  the party this evening.
You're not going to cancel the fundraiser.
This is ridiculous. You're going to be a joke to our people.
Ted, no one is going to pass a bill banning gays in the military. And if the House ever  passed such a bill, if the Senate every passed such a bill, the President would never  sign such a bill.
So, you're not going to flake on me.

This is our 5th press briefing since midnight.
